i1.name: An Acquired Taste
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Tahm Kench's''' [[basic attack]]s deal {{as|4% of his '''maximum''' health}} {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}}. Against enemy {{tip|champion|champions}} they also apply ''An Acquired Taste'' [[stack]] for 5 seconds, stacking up to 3 times, with the duration refreshing on subsequent attacks. The stacks decay once every {{fd|0.67}} seconds after the stacks reach their full duration.
{{ai|Tongue Lash|Tahm Kench}} and {{ai|Devour|Tahm Kench}} gain additional effects against enemies with 3 stacks.
i1.notes:
* By calculating ''An Acquired Taste's'' base damage, using '''Tahm Kench's''' base health, ''An Acquired Taste's'' damage can be acquired in a different way: {{as|{{passive progression/deprecated version|4/100*({{ccd|Tahm Kench|hp_base}}+{{ccd|Tahm Kench|hp_lvl}}*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1)))}}|magic damage}} {{as|(+ 4% '''bonus''' health)}} {{as|magic damage}}.
* The passive bonus damage applies to turrets.

q1.name: Tongue Lash
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Tahm Kench''' lashes his tongue in the target direction, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to the first enemy hit and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them for 3 seconds.
If an enemy champion is struck while at three {{ai|An Acquired Taste|Tahm Kench}} stacks, they're also {{tip|stun|stunned}} for 2 seconds, consuming all their stacks.

During ''Tongue Lash'', {{ai|Devour|Tahm Kench}} can be cast for no {{sti|mana|{{as|mana}}}} expenditure and cast time to swallow the {{tip|minion}} or non-epic {{tip|monster}} struck after being pulled over {{fd|0.75}} seconds at the cost of no longer dealing ''Tongue Lash's'' damage. ''Devour's'' {{as|mana}} refund does not apply in this case.
q1.notes:
* {{ai|Devour|Tahm Kench}} can be 'queued' at any point during ''Tongue Lash'' (including the wind-up animation) and will not go on cooldown if '''Tahm Kench''' fails to hit a valid target with ''Tongue Lash''.
* {{ai|Devour|Tahm Kench}}, when used in conjunction with ''Tongue Lash'', does not trigger effects that occur from {{tip|immobilize|immobilizing}} effects.{{bug}}

e1.name: Thick Skin
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Tahm Kench''' stores a percentage of the damage he takes as ''Grey Health'' on his {{as|health bar}}, up to a maximum of {{as|100% of his '''missing''' health}}.

While ''Thick Skin'' is available, and after taking no damage for {{tt|{{fd|2.5}}|Estimated}} seconds, '''Tahm Kench''' {{tt|{{fd|rapidly}}|approx. one tick every 0.8 seconds}}  {{tip|heals}} for {{passive progression/deprecated version|key=%|30 to 100}} of his ''Grey Health'' over time. Each tick heals for {{pp|12;17;23;30;38;46;55;65;76;88;100;112;125;141;157;173;190;209|1 to 18}}.
{{sbc|Active:}} '''Tahm Kench''' converts his current ''Grey Health'' into a {{tip|shield}} that lasts for 2 seconds.
e1.notes:
* ''Thick Skin'' shield value and ''Grey Health'' percentage heal are both boosted by effects that increase heal and shield power. This means '''Tahm Kench''' can technically heal more than the normal amount of ''Grey Health'' and get a shield bigger than his maximum health.
** At level 18 '''Tahm Kench''' would need {{ap|(100/65-1)*100|round=1}}% {{sti|heal power}} to heal for 100% of the damage he takes, reduced to {{ap|(100/(65*1.1)-1)*100|round=1}}% with {{ri|Revitalize}}, {{ap|(100/(65*1.3)-1)*100|round=1}}% with {{ii|Spirit Visage}}, and {{ap|(100/(65*1.1*1.3)-1)*100|round=1}}% with both.
* ''Grey Health'' converts all post-mitigation damage, ''Thick Skin'' effectively grants ''Tahm Kench'' a form of {{as|true damage}} mitigation.
* ''Grey Health'' can temporarily exceed 100% of his missing health when '''Tahm Kench''' {{tt|heals through other means|Any other source of healing besides Thick Skin}} with a ''Grey Health'' bar at 100%. In that case he will keep the higher ''Grey Health'' value for a few moments until it updates and removes the amount that he healed.
